unnormalised: Someone asked me about property rates in Gurgaon recently, so thought I'd share my 2 cents. My family was looking to invest in a flat around Golf Course Road Extension last year, around Oct 2023. We started seeing ads for 3 BHKs ranging from Rs. 1.5 Cr to Rs. 2.5 Cr, depending on the builder & exact location.
normalised: Someone asked me about property rates in Gurgaon recently, so thought I'd share my two cents. My family was looking to invest in a flat around Golf Course Road Extension last year, around October two thousand and twenty three. We started seeing ads for three B-H-K's ranging from rupee one point five crore to rupee two point five crore, depending on the builder and exact location.

unnormalised: Initially, we thought DLF was the only option, but a friend suggested checking out newer projects near Sector 57. Turns out, several builders were offering pre-launch discounts, which brought the effective cost down by maybe 5-7%. One project even claimed a connectivity advantage - being just 500 meters from the metro station.
normalised: Initially, we thought D-L-F was the only option, but a friend suggested checking out newer projects near Sector fifty seven. Turns out, several builders were offering pre-launch discounts, which brought the effective cost down by maybe five to seven percent. One project even claimed a connectivity advantage - being just five hundred meters from the metro station.

unnormalised: We were almost set on a 1200 sq ft apartment with a balcony facing the park. The broker quoted around Rs. 8000 per sq ft. But then, interest rates started creeping up! That 8.5% home loan became a lot less appealing. Plus, the stamp duty & registration charges added another 5% to the cost.
normalised: We were almost set on a one thousand two hundred square foot apartment with a balcony facing the park. The broker quoted around rupee eight thousand per square foot. But then, interest rates started creeping up! That eight point five percent home loan became a lot less appealing. Plus, the stamp duty and registration charges added another five percent to the cost.

unnormalised: Ultimately, we decided to postpone our purchase. It felt like the market was a bit inflated. Now, I'm seeing similar flats advertised for slightly less – maybe Rs. 1.4 Cr. It all depends on timing, the builder's reputation, and your own financial situation. Do your research, check out the area physically, and don't rush into anything.
normalised: Ultimately, we decided to postpone our purchase. It felt like the market was a bit inflated. Now, I'm seeing similar flats advertised for slightly less – maybe rupee one point four crore.
